item.title: Subway Surfers Is Getting a Sequel Next Month
item.content:encoded:
The sequel to Subway Surfers, Subway Surfer City, releases on February 26, 2026; interested players can pre-register now.

Subway Surfers is undoubtedly not only one of the most popular endless runners out there, but also one of the most-played mobile games. I know I have spent hours on end trying achieve the highest score and beat all my friends. Fans of this game can now look forward to a brand new sequel, which introduces a lot of new stuff.

Subway Surfers City Release Date Revealed

Revealed through a new post on X (formerly Twitter), Subway Surfers City arrives next month with new gameplay mechanics, game modes, challenges, and improved visuals. A new press release on Business Wire by the developer SYBO reveals some of the new mechanics players will be able to try out.

The game will introduce a ‚Äústomp move‚Äù that can be used to reveal hidden advantages, a ‚Äúbouncy bubblegum shield‚Äù that can enhance your jump abilities, and more.

Additionally, there are three new modes to look forward to once Subway Surfers City is released. Classic Endless, the endless runner experience where players chase new high scores. The City Tour, which is a finite game mode where players will progress through levels, complete goals and explore districts while completing missions and finding hidden stars. Lastly, there is the Events mode, which will feature a rotation of finite runs and trials.

The original Subway Surfers game crossed 4.5 billion lifetime downloads in 2025, making it the most downloaded mobile game of all time, so the sequel has some pretty big shoes to fill.

Interested readers can pre-register for Subway Surfers City prior to its release on the Google Play Store and iOS App Store.

In other news, a new Life is Strange game is scheduled to be revealed next week. Additionally, PlayStation recently delisted over 1,000 shovelware games from its store. Will you be playing Subway Surfers City once it releases next month? Leave your thoughts on all this and more down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more tech news from Insider Gaming, check out the exclusive report on CM Punk headlining WWE 2K26‚Äôs Showcase Mode. Don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Is The Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake About To Shadow Drop? Live Tracker
item.content:encoded:
The Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake has been in the pipeline for years from Ubisoft, but reports suggest that the sands of time could be running out on its release date‚Äîcourtesy of a shadow drop.

A shadow drop never goes amiss. Last year‚Äôs Oblivion Remastered shadow drop drama was absolute cinema. When the moment came for Bethesda to drop one of the greatest RPGs ever onto all of our laps at a moment‚Äôs notice, the world lost its mind. The long-awaited Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake isn‚Äôt quite on that level, but it would be incredible if Ubisoft dropped a late Christmas present.

Is A Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake Shadow Drop Happening?

Insider Gaming cannot confirm or deny the existence of a Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake shadow drop happening imminently, but it would line up with the reported belief of a mid-January 2026 release.

If you‚Äôre an Insider Gaming regular, you know the site‚Äôs coverage of Ubisoft titles is exceptional. If you‚Äôre new here, IG has followed The Sands of Time Remake‚Äôs journey since the beginning. An exclusive story even revealed everything about the Sands of Time Remake and its shaky development.

On May 14, 2025, it was confirmed that the Prince of Persia: Sands of Time Remake Would Release by April 2026. Suddenly, we‚Äôre not too far from the end of the window.

After that, Insider Gaming dropped another exclusive, featuring an update on the Sands of Time Remake update. Sources revealed that the Sands of Time Remake was targeting a ‚Äòmid-January 2026‚Ä≤ launch. It‚Äôs believed that Ubisoft wanted to release the POP: The Sands of Time Remake before the Assassin‚Äôs Creed Black Flag Remake, and this could be the case.

But drama unfolded on January 15, when a report from the @popuniverseX account (which has been suspended as a result) revealed that a ton of Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time images and files were uploaded between December 31, 2025, and January 13, 2026.

The most intriguing file was one that had ‚Äúgame-release-tomorrow‚Äù in it!

Make of this what you will. Can Insider Gaming say for certain that a Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake is happening for certain? No. But don‚Äôt be surprised if Ubisoft suddenly drops the announcement in the coming days.

Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake Shadow Drop Live Tracker

Currently, the Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake has not been released and received the rumored shadow drop, but Insider Gaming will update this if it happens.

Keep checking back to this article for new updates on the potential shadow drop. Any new rumors, leaks, or official announcements will be reported on.

Check out the free-to-join Insider Gaming Discord Server for all gaming talks, rumors, leaks, and news.

If you missed it, a unique POP: Sands of Time Remake gameplay presentation leaked online in 2025.
